info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 12:43PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BRYAN AND CHATHAM COUNTIES... At 1242 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Fort Mcallister, or 10 miles south of Coffee Bluff, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph and up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Richmond Hill, Coffee Bluff, Montgomery, Fort Mcallister, Keller and Skidaway Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
